title: Sustainability is the future
position: A focus on sustainability-related factors -- ranging from carbon efficiency to quality of governance -- may help investors build more resilient portfolios.
disclosure:

title: Geopolitics drives markets
position: We see a pause in U.S.-China tensions, but with bouts of turbulence along the way and no let-up in structural frictions.
disclosure:

title: Building diversified portfolios
position: Lower returns ahead mean investors need to think differently about how they build diversified, long-term portfolios â€“ across instruments and asset classes. Consider uncovering varied sources of return across indexing, factor and alpha-seeking strategies in a cost-efficient manner.
disclosure:

title: Real resilience
position: Supercharged structural trends will change the nature of portfolio diversification. Countries and sectors will make a comeback as diversifiers in a more fragmented world, in our view, offering resilience to real economy trends.
disclosure:

title: A bigger role for private markets
position: According to data from Preqin, Private markets have tripled in size since December 2007, and can be expected to play a significant role in the recovery from the COVID shock â€“giving investors access to an important avenue of future value creation.

title: The new nominal
position: We see stronger growth and lower real yields ahead as the vaccine led restart accelerates and central banks limit the rise of nominal yields even as inflation expectations climb. Inflation will have different implications to the past.
disclosure:

title: Globalization rewired
position: Covid-19 has accelerated geopolitical transformations such as a bipolar U.S.-China world order and a remaking of global supply chains, placing greater weight on resilience and less on efficiency.
disclosure:

title: Turbocharged transformations
position: The pandemic has added fuel to pre-existing structural trends such as an increased focus on sustainability, rising inequality within and across nations, and the dominance of e-commerce at the expense of traditional retail.
disclosure:
